thread.title: Planned Parenthood hack: Anti-abortion group claims credit | The
thread.title_full: Planned Parenthood hack: Anti-abortion group claims credit | The Advertiser

author: REBECCA SULLIVAN and AP
title: Planned Parenthood hack: Anti-abortion group claims credit | The
text:
AN anti-abortion group has hacked Planned Parenthood’s computer system and released details of its employees.
The US health service made headlines recently after anti-abortion group Centre for Medical Progress secretly recorded Planned Parenthood officials talking about how they provide aborted foetal organs for research.
It’s not clear whether the hackers were from the same anti-abortion group who leaked the videos.
The anti-abortion hackers have released Planned Parenthood’s website databases as well as names and email addresses of the organisation’s employees, The Daily Dot reports.
Planned Parenthood’s admin username and passwords are listed on a website, along with hundreds of employee email addresses.
At this stage, the hack has not exposed the personal data of patients or employees.
In a statement, Planned Parenthood’s executive vice president Daw Laguens said her organisation had notified the US Department of Justice and the FBI of the data breach.
“We treat matters of safety and security with the utmost importance, and are taking every measure possible to mitigate these criminal efforts to undermine our mission and services, ”she said.
“Planned Parenthood is the most trusted women’s health care provider in [the US] and anti-abortion extremists are willing to do anything to stop women from accessing the reproductive health care they are seeking.
“Extremists have broken laws, harassed our doctors and patients, produced hack videos, and now are claiming to have committed a gross invasion of privacy — one that, if true, could potentially put our staff members at risk.
“No matter what extremist acts those who oppose safe and legal abortion commit, the fact remains that women and men across America will still need access to basic, reproductive health care: lifesaving cancer screenings, birth control, STI testing and treatment, well-woman exams, and yes, safe and legal abortion. As always, we will continue to provide that care, and serve the 2.7 million women, men and young people who rely on us each year.”
The hackers call themselves “social justice warriors” who are “seeking to reclaim some sort of lulz [sic] for the years and thousands of dollars that Planned Parenthood have wasted and made harvesting your babies,” according to their website, which news.com.au has chosen not to name or link to.
In the previously released videos , recorded in 2014 and 2015 by people posing as buyers of foetal tissue footage shows Planned Parenthood officials discussing the amount the group charges to provide the organs and the abortion procedures used to obtain the organs.
In Australia, abortion is still illegal in NSW and Queensland, except for when a doctor believes a woman’s physical and/or mental health is in serious danger. In NSW social, economic and medical factors may also be taken into account. Abortion is legal in all other states and territories in Australia, with varying policies.
Originally published as Details of abortion workers hacked
